## parsePattern() function

Parse an [ICU NumberFormatter pattern](http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-numbers.html#Number_Format_Patterns) string into a [Skeleton](./messageformat-number-skeleton.skeleton.md) structure.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function parsePattern(src: string, currency?: string): Skeleton;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  src | <code>string</code> | The pattern string |
|  currency | <code>string</code> | If the pattern includes Â¤ tokens, their skeleton representation requires a three-letter currency code. |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Skeleton`

## Remarks

Unlike the skeleton parser, the pattern parser is not able to return partial results on error, and will instead throw. Output padding is not supported.

## Example


```js
import { parseSkeleton } from 'messageformat-number-skeleton'

parseSkeleton('compact-short currency/GBP', console.error)
// {
//   notation: { style: 'compact-short' },
//   unit: { style: 'currency', currency: 'GBP' }
// }

```
